The villager was expecting her to want revenge, and they have a secret weapon!
131332111112212.content:
Wendy's little airship was abuzz with activity. The crew of a few dozen was a mixed bunch of Bowser's citizens, but mostly consisted of paragoombas and paratroopas, fluttering around on their feathery little wings, performing their little tasks. Of course, only about half of those tasks were related to flying the ship, as most of the crew was doting on and attending to the needs- and more importantly, the wants- of their spoiled swollen superior. The blobbish Wendy O. Koopa lounged in her own fat, her eyes closed in relaxation with a lazy smirk on her face. Simply opening her mouth was all she had to do to prompt a several of her paratroopas to scramble up to feed her, shoving a burger or two or maybe a couple handfuls of cake into her empty mouth 'til it was nearly overflowing. Wendy would leisurely chew and swallow whatever she was fed, not caring if a few loose crumbs tumbled out or a bit of grease dripped down her thick roll of a double chin, before she'd open her greedy maw to be fed once again- Though occasionally she'd punctuate it with a loud belch. Her heart monitor beeped softly, as a couple of koopas stood by the mobile cabinet which held her life support system, cautiously keeping an eye on its readings. After all, she wasn't supposed to be having anything greasy or sugary, let alone the vast amount she was consuming right then. But she was their princess, and they all knew that what she wants she gets, no matter what. One paratroopa held her oxygen mask, nervously glancing over to the cabinet, and whenever he noticed a change in activity or heard Wendy start to pant and gasp, he would flutter over and press the mask to her lips and nose, allowing her to take a few deep breaths, before her condition returned to normal and she waved him off, continuing to eat, her mammoth form jiggling with every bite she took and move she made. A pair of hammer bros were situated at the base of her enormously thick legs, one for each, dutifully lapping away at her soles. Her feet had swollen up considerably, along with the rest of her body, each of her three toes alone was nearly as big as a goomba, and a super thick layer of soft tender fat made her feet each feel as squishy and fatty as the rest of her body, and they had become so massive that they'd be considerably dangerous and powerful stompin' weapons, assuming Wendy could still at least waddle, so it was all the hammer bros could do to try and cover their whole surface with their tongues, briefly pausing to take a few heavy breaths. One of them made a mental note to suggest that perhaps it would be a good idea to get some boos to do this, as their notedly large tongues would be better suited. The other made a mental note to put in a request to be transferred to working for Iggy or Roy or something.

Eventually, as Wendy binged her brains out on her little personal cruise, one of the paratroopas who crammed a burger and a fistful of cake into her mouth spoke. "Uh- that...that was the last of it, your majesty." He told her. Wendy opened one eye to look at the nervous green shelled koopa. She munched up and swallowed the final mouthful, before loudly belching directly into his face, making him clutch his nostrils and jump, hovering back a few feet. Wendy smirked, opening her other eye and rubbing her stomach lovingly with one pudgy hand.
"Aaaah....now that wash a good meal. Thoshe jerksh at the hoshpital, trying to reshtrict my eating habitsh? BBRRUUUUUAAARRRRPP!!! Inshulting." A murmur of hesitant agreement came from the crew surrounding her. The paratroopa who was holding her oxygen mask nervously fluttered forwards.
"Uh- Princess? Now that you're not eating, do you want your mask back?" He said hesitantly, presenting it to her. She glanced over at him, an eyebrow raised.
"Hm? Oh- My okshagen mashk? Uhh... Shure, what the heck, jusht put it right back on me." She said casually. The paratroopa did just that, careful not to mess up her bow as he stretched the elastic over her head, securing the mask. Wendy took a deep breath of the clean air being pumped to her. "aaah....thoshe shtupid doctorsh...You'd think if they were gonna give me a life shupport thingie they'd at leasht have the deshenshy to build in a feeding tube." The paratroopa nodded in agreement, before fluttering back and landing next to the two koopas standing near the cabinet.

Wendy's belly had grown swollen once again because of her feast, growing more rotund and taut than flabby. The pink skin bulging out from between between the plates of her underbelly each protruded a bit further, spreading them wider apart, and had turned from pink to a light red, the way it bloated up in size had elevated her fatty breasts even more, and the whole thing stuck out a bit further now than it had before. She rubbed it proudly with the hand that wasn't holding the wand, giving it a gentle slap and feeling it wobble, as it emitted a few low gurgles in reaction to the impact. She looked around, taking a moment to appreciate the view from the height of the airship. The ship was cruising along the border of a Koopa Territory and the Mushroom Kingdom. She could spot a desert with pyramids and an icy tundra with glaciers right next to each other on horizon to the right, and to the left that accursed red and white castle Princess Peach lived in...when she wasn't caged up in one of her daddy's dungeons. Straight ahead, she knew, was the castle where Bowser himself lived, along with her and all her siblings, they were headed there to drop her back off. It would be nice to be back home again. She recalled the morning she got the wand- what- three? Four days ago? She found the village and fell asleep in the girl's room the first day, woke up the second day and ate her way through the barrier then passed out, spent the third day in the hospital- and they just let her out today. So- yeah, it was four. Well, this was certainly better than being bored in her room like she was- An adventure like this. But...well.... she thought about it. They'd just drop her back in her room again. Nothing wrong with her room of course, she liked her room. But considering she spent most of this adventure passed out or in a hospital...she wanted to cap it off before she went back to her relaxing luxurious lifestyle...until the next time she got bored. She looked over to the wand in her right hand, holding it up so the sun caught its beautiful pink crystal. She smirked to herself, how better to cap off an adventure like this- she thought- than with a heaping helping of revenge?

"Hey- You! Pilot!" She roared The blue shelled boomerang bro who was currently at the helm jumped, and turned to face his obese boss, still clutching the wheel, keeping the airship steady.
"Y-y-yes, Princess Wendy?" he said, nervously.
"We're heading back home right? To daddy'sh cashtle?" She asked, most of the crew's attention was on her. They didn't want to miss it if she suddenly started to order them around, god forbid they didn't hear her.
"Uh- yes, Princess Wendy. Is...is there somewhere else you'd like to go?" He asked. The red shelled fire bro next to him, serving as his navigator, quickly pulled up his charts to make any necessary changes to the course he had plotted.
"Ash a matter of fact, yesh." Wendy said, smirking, her eyes narrowed menacingly. "Bring me back to that filthy little mushroom village I was found in yeshterday...and get the bullet billsh and bob-ombsh ready." She ordered, a wicked fangy grin spreading beneath her oxygen mask as her wand gleamed ominously.

The peaceful toad village was already paranoid, the recent experience with Bowser's bloated brat just earlier that week leaving the population shaken. Especially since she'd ended up eating so much that the Koopa military squad who was sent to check up on her had to call in a second squad to knock down the poor toad's house and carry her out. Many didn't see this, as they were cowering in their houses hiding at the time. But the few toads brave enough to peek out the windows told stories about how huge she was. They said she was the size of a thwomp, but almost completely round. A big golden sphere tinted bright red from how tightly she was stuffed, Wendy's chubby bust and bottom partially sunken into her globe of a midsection. After she and her koopas departed, the toads began repairs of their town. They threw out all the things she turned into food that she couldn't eat, and swept up the rubble of the areas she destroyed. They actually did a pretty good job fixing it all up.

Shame it all had to go.

Wendy grinned as she looked down at the chaos unfolding past the golden horizon of her own fat form, dotted with electrodes here and there and a wire powering her implantable cardioverter-defibrillator. As annoying as the high pitched raspy screeches of a toad were to her, they somehow seemed a whole lot easier on the ears when they were screams of terror and suffering. Her cheeks bunched up as she turned her head to the side to look, the fat swallowing up almost half of her face and forcing her to almost completely close one eye. Her own love handles also sprawled out pretty far, two thick rolls of fat billowing out and pooling as they rested on even more of her fat, working in conjunction with her incredibly thick arm like two sagging monster truck tires with a pudgy sausage fingered hand poking out also blocked her view somewhat. She wanted a better look at the carnage of her revenge! If those worthless toads were gonna learn to stay out of her way she at least wanted to be there for it. Suddenly, she got an idea, her thick plump pink lips pulling into a smirk.

"Paratroopash!" She called out. Her voice sounded a bit deeper than it used to, and was definitely breathier as she got winded quickly while talking, even with that oxygen mask. But it was still unmistakable, and her command brought all the feathery winged koopas fluttering to a halt where they were and turning their attention to her. "New plan, you guysh aren't gonna partishipate in the ashault! At leasht, not in the shame way everyone elshe ish..." The Paratroopas exchanged a glance between each other, slightly confused by her statement, and honestly- a bit worried. "I'll eckshplain in a shecond, firsht carry my ash down there, to the middle of town!"

Obediently rushing to complete their corpulent commander's order, about two dozen paratroopas crowded around the massive cushiony mattress she rested her immobile bulk on, her fat fleshy rolls bulging out in a few of their faces. A few went off to the side to pick up her life support cabinet and oxygen tanks, knowing how important it was that they remained attached considering she showed no signs of slowing her unhealthy habits. The koopas all grunted as they flapped their wings as hard as they could, even their collective strength was being tested by the 1,700 pounds of princess pudge they were hauling. They managed to get her up into the air and bring her to the ground, her blob like form sloshing from side to side and jiggling like a pile of jello on a plate as they struggled to keep her stable. The few toads who caught sight of her would see she was even bigger than the stories, and anyone who told those stories would confirm that yes, she had gotten even bigger. No part of her body wasn't enormous, a belly stuffed so full of burgers and cake that it seemed like a great balloon, the horizontal plates of her stomach scales insufficient to cover all of it. The pale yellow plates were spread apart like open blinds, and the pale pinkish flesh of her fat gut bulged out, striped by a few stretch marks. Her belly was so full and round that the way it attached to the rest of her body put to mind the image of a big spherical boulder rolling into a pile of dough which it sunk partially into. She was a mess of golden fat folds, broken by her bulbous lower body- a rump which was sagging and pooling out at the bottom due to being all fat, but retaining a somewhat voluptuous rotund shape. Each asscheek was bigger than a full sized chain chomp, and it looked like both of them combined would be able to rival her belly in size. Her billowing thighs were huge doughy rings of flab, bulging outwards as they squished up against her belly, forcing them to spread. Her calves didn't even touch the ground, they were also so much thicker than they were long that they were like rings, except they were still smaller than her thighs, so they'd partially sunken into them, her thigh fat encroaching over her calves so that they were squeezed out more a bit, the bottom part of the fat being enough so to touch her heel as the top part was touching the top of her toes. Her feet were far too large to conceivably squeeze into her old pair of high heels, growing proportionally wider as well since their new size came entirely from fat. Her pink painted toeclaws had stayed the same size as ever though, and had almost entirely been swallowed up by her round doughy orbs of toes, only their sharp little tips poking out from a fat fold.

Her hips were incredibly wide, despite being overtaken in width by her rump and belly. She had some deliciously thick love handles which proudly flared out from her sides into two big rolls of flab, which squished up against the back part of her round gut and came out to about three quarters of her thigh where they rested, hugged from behind by her powerful rump which they partially spilled onto. At the top of her butt, sandwiched between the cheeks was her tail. Despite it having grown fat enough to almost submerge the two triangular spines growing from it, it was only half visible as a nice plump set of three rolls of back fat poured over it, the size of her rump meaning it bulged out so far and so high resting on the ground that it was pushing her back fat up even higher, it encroached so high over her one big roll of shoulderblade fat that it almost touched the two smaller rolls of neck fat above it, over which a tiny sliver of the back of her head was visible, topped by her signature spotted bow.

She couldn't really bend her arms at all, as they were in a similar spot as her legs, just two huge tires of bulging slightly sagging flab, though her forearm was a bit higher up, positioned closer to her padded shoulder as the fat on her bicep sagged down enough to rest on her love handles. They were only discernable as arms because of her pudgy hands which had fat swallowing them up to the wrist. Her palms looked like cake decorating bags full of icing, and her fingers were big enough that her ring would've snapped off if they didn't have the foresight to remove it. In her right hand, with only a tiny bit of difficulty, she clutched the wand- her fat spreading out a bit as it squished against the handle.

Her breasts were suitably massive, nearly as big as her calves, and the rising curve of her gut both elevating them and forcing them to sag spread out to the sides to make way for it. Between them in her cleavage, affixed to her chest, was the wire which powered her ICD. Above that was her thick, proud double chin which had overwhelmed her pearl necklace and would tantalizingly wobble as she talked or ate. Her cheeks were puffed out big as basketballs, resting on her shoulders and squishing her face between them. Her luscious pink lips were an evil smug smile behind the mask of her CPAP machine. Her lashes brushed against her cheek fat as her flawless mascara and eye shadow shone, lids lowered almost like she was giving bedroom eyes to someone, although a sinister glint was in the reptilian pupils of her piercing blue eyes.

When the paratroopas had finally set her heaving bulk down, her lazy overindulged form still somehow sweating harder than they were despite the hard work they just did, they nervously flew up to her line of sight, afraid they knew what she'd order next.

"Now- hear me all membersh of my army, not jusht you paratroopash but everyone! Shpread thish meshage to anyone who can't hear me now! I want you to fan through thish ENTIRE town, shearch every houshe- every kitchen, every shtore or reshtaurant or bakery or anything you can find! Gather up every lasht crumb of any and all kindsh of food you can poshibly find! And ash shoon ash you get your clawsh on even the shmallesht morshel of food- I want you to bring it back here- and feed ALL of it to ME!"

It was exactly what they were expecting.

Wendy stuffed the last few bites of peanut brittle into her mouth.

"Uhhrf." She belched against the back of her arm. "I gotta walk this off."

Groaning, she managed to get to her feet. She scratched her belly idly, moving her claws back and forth over the smooth, dry scales and feeling the enormous mass of junk food within.

She had seriously difficulty getting through the mushroom-sized doorway. After a lot of grunting and perspiration, she managed to squeeze herself through. Her size was mostly bloat, but not all; the tens of thousands of calories she was forcing down her gullet were starting to take their toll, rounding out her paunch and turning her hips into a pair of miniature hams.

The wind swept through Mona's long hair she sped wildly down the country road. Her moped was performing admirably, considering its cargo...usually, it only had to carry its thin driver, and a couple of pizzas. But today? Well, she had gotten an order for an absolutely insane amount of pizzas...apparently, there was some enormous party going on (that she hadn't been invited to...alas), and they had ordered enough pizza to feed an army. Because of that, Mona had hitched a small caravan of three enormous trailers to her wee little moped, each of the trailers chock full of the world's most delicious pizza. It was a credit to her absurdly powerful little moped that it still blazed past the land like a bullet.

As she merrily drove, looking forward to receiving the massive payment that awaited her upon delivery (to say nothing of the tip), she began to happily sing.

"This here is Mona Pizza!
Makers of the world's best eatsa!
Fresh sauce and cheese galore,
Brought straight to your front door!

This here is Mona Pizza!
Makers of all tasty treatsa!
Our pie's crispy, crunchy crust,
Leaves others in the dust.

Grab a hot slice and take a big bite!
It's so good that you'll start a fight,
For more MONA PIZZAAAAAA!!"

At this point, she clenched her eyes shut, and rose her voice into a beautiful crescendo...managing to entirely miss the fact that there was an enormous pothole dead ahead, which she was fast approaching. So, her moped dipped into it mightily, sending the trailers crashing into the back of it, launching it ahead violently, and causing a mightily impressive crash that tumbled on for quite a while, consisting of moped, trailers, and one very startled but unharmed Mona. Eventually, they all came to a stop. Mona got up to her feet wearily, and dusted herself off as she approached her moped..which was now short one wheel.

"Well...crap." she muttered.

She surveyed the rest of the crash site. The trailers were all intact, and she could see her moped's missing wheel laying in the grass a few dozen feet away, looking rather lonely.

"Hmph." she grunted as she sat down on the ground, and drew out her cell phone.

"...hey, Joe? Yeah, it's Mona. I got into a crash on the way to the-...no, no, I'm okay. My moped's banged up pretty bad, though. Any chance you could send someone down here to pick me up, and finish the delivery?...awesome! Thanks, Joe. How long until-?...AN HOUR AND A HALF!?...no, no, I'll be okay that long, I guess. Alright, seeya soon. Bye."

Mona sighed as she clicked her phone shut. This day had taken a rather amazing turn for the worse. As she sat feeling sorry for herself, she found herself eyeballing the trailers full of pizza, and she realized that she was hungry, and furthermore, just wanted some comfort food after her frightening ordeal. Surely, the people wouldn't miss just one pizza (...or two...or...) from the whole enormous order?...but then again, eating the pizza that you yourself are supposed to be delivering is a cardinal sin in the industry. What to do?

A few hours later, Ashley and Red were both zooming around the city on her broomstick, still searching for a potential mate for Ashley. “So Ashley, repeat this to me again… You’re just going to grab some guy and tell him that he’s now your girlfriend?” “Exactly.” “Well… Eh, what if he says ‘no’?” “He won’t. Now, who’d be the type of person to be attracted to a girl who’s a witch and into magic?” This was a question Red knew the answer to, but he was almost convinced that said answer would piss off Ashley like all hell. He hesitated, but quickly remembered that Ashley also got easily ticked off having to wait. “Um… No, not really.” Red lied. “Red, don’t lie. You’re really bad at it.” Ashley flatly said.

“Oh boy, got me, heh heh…” He gave a painfully forced answer, the sweat forming on the side of his head getting slightly blown away by the wind. “But you’re not going to like the answer. Well… Um… I think only geeks are going to like you. I mean, it’s only logical that a socially awkward recluse who’s into magic is going to attract socially awkward recluses who’re into playing video games about magic… Heh?” Ashley slowly turned to him, with a small frown. “Red, don’t ever call me a socially awkward recluse again. But I don’t get what the problem is. If the guy’s into the same stuff I am, I don’t really care if he’s popular, outgoing or active and what not.” She gave Red a look which made him gulp a bit. A look of brewing idyllic mischief. “I mean, it won’t matter when he’s locked up in my bedroom. Not much use for a boyfriend outside of THAT department.”

Lowering her broom, she stopped outside what Red told her would be the haven for her type. A video game shop. Walking in, she’s greeted by aisles upon aisles of brightly coloured boxes, with boys with almost zombie like stares playing amongst the large series of TV’s. “Well, this should be easy. Half these guys are dressed even weirder than me.” Ashley mused to herself, before strolling along. Before she could get far, Ashley felt a tap on a shoulder and looked around, having to look down. “Hi Ashley! Man, funny seeing you here! Or anywhere other than your house for that matter!” A bouncy 9-Volt said, holding half a dozen game boxes in one hand. “Oh. Hello.” Kneeling down to his own height, Ashley began to lower her tone. “You can help me. Which one of these boys here would be willing to… Um… Date? That’s the term, yeah, ‘date’ me?” 9-Volt gave a surprised look, yet then a grin formed on his face.

“Heh, I hate icky stuff like dating, but we’re friends so I’ll help you out.” He quickly led her to a distant corner of the shop and pointed at a tall kid in dark clothing, idly staring at a game box. “He may seem ‘tough’ on the outside, but you’ll find that he’s actually really into geeky culture and really friendly if he trusts. Really seems your type.” Ashley had a quick look around. “He’s the only one?” She asked. “Nah, most here would date you, they’re really desperate, including this guy. Just that he’s one of the few who won’t totally creep you out. Yo, Tyler!” 9-Volt called out, and the initially solemn figure became brighter when he turned around. “Oh, it’s you! How’s it going little bro?” Turning to see Ashley, his smile faded. “Oh. Who’s this friend of yours?” “Ashley. Okay, that’s pleasantries out of the way, does that make him my boyfriend now 9-Volt?” Tyler stepped back a bit, somewhat confused. “Is this some kind of pr-“ “Don’t worry, she’s just really blunt. And apparently needs a boyfriend ASAP.” His face lit up. “Well, the Tyler-nator is always available for a dark girl like you- WHA” With the mention of the word ‘available’, quickly grabbed his arm, nodded towards 9-Volt as a sign of thanks and ran out the shop, hopping on her broom and flying off with Tyler behind her.

After taking a minute to recover from the fainting spell that gazing upon such a glorious prize brought on, she ordered the crew to begin loading everything up. And now here they were. The Captain had announced a massive party to celebrate this unexpected find, and as soon as everything had been put into proper storage. The treasure went to the vaults, the food went to the kitchen and pantry, and the statue went to the spacious main hall where she intended to use it as a throne during the proceedings. Soon a great and boisterous party was set up. A great table was set, and massive barrels of every available drink were rolled out and tapped. There was no shortage of food; Captain Syrup had ordered her chefs to put all their knowledge to bear and cook up a storm of delicious dishes of every shape and size. Before anyone ate, the Captain raised a massive flagon and raised a toast.

"AVAST, YE HEARTIES, WAIT A DAMN MINUTE. I got somethin' to say. This here is the damned finest haul ever since that giant golden statue we plundered from the Mushroom Kingdom... And this time, we ain't losin' this haul. So let's CELEBRATE!"

Everyone roared in agreement, as they knocked glasses and drank deeply. For one moment, the eyes of the statue seemed to gleam, but everyone was far too lost in consumption to notice.

The party went on long into the night. So long in fact, that most of the crew, Captain Syrup included, had simply fallen asleep at the table, lulled by drink and full stomachs. Syrup stirred, as the eyes of the statue began to glow...

It was a bright, sunny morning in the beautiful little town of Parfait, and the citizens of the town were mostly waking up, getting prepared to start their days.

One particular citizen was up even earlier than most, the dilligent and cheerful Isabelle being sure to show up to her place of work at Town Hall ahead of time, to get a jump start on the day.

As Isabelle came in, she noticed something on her desk. A rather large box of a dozen donuts, with an also quite large paper cup next to it- the cup smelled like it was filled with hot chocolate.

"Hm? How did this stuff get here?" Isabelle wondered out loud, before taking a closer look and seeing a note stuck on to the box. The note said 'for Isabelle, Be in soon, hope you enjoy! -from Mayor'

Isabelle chuckled to herself. "Hehehe- aw, isn't that sweet." She sat down at her desk, taking one of the donuts and starting to eat as she began to get a little work done.

As she went on, Isabelle was mainly focusing on the files she was sorting through and making notes on and forms she was filling out, that she didn't pay much attention to how she was filling out herself. After finishing one donut, she'd idly take another- intending to only have two...or maybe three. After all, they were especially tasty donuts- Heavily glazed with rich frosting, large and thick enough for each one to be savored. Breaking it up with sips of hot chocolate.

Soon enough, as Isabelle's paw reached for another one- she found nothing, and realized with a start she'd eaten all 12, finishing off the substantially sized hot chocolate to boot.

"Oh! Ohhh darn it-" Isabelle said, sighing. Part of her was disappointed because she wished there was more, but as she placed a paw gently on her tummy, feeling that slight bloat as the waistline of her skirt hugged her a bit more snugly than before, she was relieved there weren't more.

"I need to be more careful not to get carried away..." She mused, as she closed the empty box, and put it and the empty cup off to the side.

--

Soon after she polished off her little treat, the Mayor arrived- running in with a big smile on their face. Isabelle immediately perked up.

"Good morning Mayor!" She said, cheerily. "How are you doing today?"

"I'm good- but Isabelle! Guess what?" The mayor said, walking up to her desk, visibly excited. "A brand new restaurant opened up in town!" They announced proudly.

Isabelle blinked, a little bit surprised. "Oh! A new restaurant?" She looked down at her desk, quickly flipping through the papers, searching for anything about that. "I don't remember doing the-"

"Oh, I did the paperwork for it." The mayor said, "You already do so much paperwork, I figured I should take up one or two things myself."

Perched atop the soft, shaking monument, undulating and jiggling like perpetual motion machines, were here enormous round breasts, still somehow maintaining some degree of perkiness, while also being the size of cars. Her face, presumably, was somewhere, but it certainly couldn't be seen from Lisa's position. Tina was piled so high with fat, she ended up probably being over twenty feet tall. The thought that her normal-sized skeleton still rested in the vast mounds of flesh like some now silly-seeming vestige made Lisa shake her head in disbelief.

All of Tina's corpulence was covered in food. Crumbs, melted chocolate, syrup, sauce, debris and messes of other descriptions, littered her body, collecting mostly on her folds, or any of the relatively flat surfaces that her vast but thoroughly rounded body had.

Lisa could also see that there was a ladder and catwalk suspended above Tina, which the person must use whenever they need to get on or off of her. And as the person finished feeding Tina the current batch of food, they began to ascend the ladder...and Lisa realized that the person actually wasn't sitting down. They were standing up on her. Jesus Christ.

THIS WAS NOT TRAINING IN ANY FORM!
THIS WAS THE MOST GLUTTONOUS LIVING THING ON THE PLANET INDULGING IN PURE, SHAMELESS, FANATICAL HEDONISM!

15532222222221111.content:
The sun rose over Megaton, just like it did every day.

The lone wanderer got out of bed and slipped into her well-worn trenchcoat, hijacked from an enclave Colonel, fastening it up, followed by her well-worn fedora like every day.

She grabbed her trusty plasma rifle and shocksword, just like every day.

Trotting past her Mr. Handy robot butler, ignoring its chipper, british-accented greeting, she opened the door to once again venture out into the wasteland and see if there were any new enemies to clear out today. Ever since she and the Brotherhood of Steel had wiped out the majority of the Enclave presence and a good chunk of the super mutant infestation, all that there was to fight were scattered raiders and mutated animals.

So <i>boring.</i> Oh well, not as if there was anything else to do. She made a mental list, deciding on stopping by Craterside Supply for a few microfusion cells for her rifle and perhaps a bit of Rad-x antiradiation chems. Heading around the corner of her home and down a ramp towards the commons, she worked her way through the cluster of residents and visitors, nodding towards Sheriff Simms as she passed him, and barely containing her urge to beat down that sleazebag Moriarty, proprietor of the local bar, as he tried to once again trick someone out of their hard-earned money. The smell of crispy iguana-on-a-stick, as always deliciously prepared by Jenny Stahl, wafted across the breeze. For what it was worth, the Brass Latern (megaton's local eatery), was pretty damned good.

A short walk later, and she was upon Moira's store. Opening the door with a creak, she trotted inside, glancing at the security guard the ever-cheerful Ms. Brown had hired. "Heeyyy there! How are ya today?" the red-headed shopkeep piped up. The wanderer shrugged. "Same old, same old. Less and less for me to do. So, you got any MF cells today?" With a nod, Moira reached behind the counter and pulled out a few. "Here ya go." Handing over the cash necessary, and a nod of thanks, 101, as she was known by the wasteland's resident newscaster Three-dog after her Vault's number, placed them in her rucksack.

"So, how's the survival guide I helped you with going?" Nearly cringing at the memories, she recalled assisting Moira with a book, being a "field researcher", which more often then not involved risking her neck (if she had to go into a mirelurk nest again she'd jump off a cliff) or injuring herself accidentally or (in two cases) intentionally in the name of <i>Science!</i> (which she had now realized was different from the generally accepted view of science). <i>Science!</i> was very much a thing the energetic Brown enjoyed. The crimson-haired merchant smiled warmly. "Darn good, in fact, it's already sold 500 copies in the past month! It's a tidy little profit AND I'm helping people." Of course, the occasionally clueless scientist-wannabe was a bit misinformed, if well-intentioned, although 101 had gently nudged her in the right direction. "Good to hear. Say, Moira, I barely ever see you outside of here, why don't I take you along to see the sights of DC sometime?" She gestured over her shoulder with her thumb towards the door of the shop. "Now that the Brotherhood and I have cleared most of it out, it's much safer. You could use a break, and I could use something to do."

Placing a hand to her chin, Moira let out a little hmm. "Well, I suppose it could be fun!" 101 smiled a little bit, odd for her normally serious demeanor, hardened from a good year straight of fighting. "Well then, how about after lunch? I'll just be over by the Vault for a while, Dogmeat ran off chasing radroaches again, he usually hangs around there if we get seperated." Her trusty canine companion had a habit of doing that, but c'est la vie. "Sounds nifty. Deal!" With a wave, 101 walked outside, her bespectacled, brunette self realizing that for all the people she knew, none, bar Fawkes (one of two non-barbaric super mutants she had ever met) and Three-dog, were really <i>friends,</i> having had no time to truly make them.

However absentminded, eccentric, and sometimes mind-bogglingly gullible she was, Moira would would be a good friend, she mused. Proceeding out the gate of the township, she hummed along to a catchy little number about some guy named pete that gently played from her radio on her Pip-boy wrist computer.

Just like every day.

15532222222221223111.content:
Wiping condensation of the bathroom mirror, Nora brushed a loose strand of her brown hair behind her ear. Behind her, she heard her husband, Nate.
"Did you do something to your hair?" He asked, peering into the mirror.
"Why, yes I did. I do have the best hairdresser in Boston working on my hair", she replied, flashing him a smile.
"If you say so. Now, if you're done, could I use the mirror? I need to shave", Nate said, gesturing to his chin.

Leaving her husband, Nora headed into the kitchen, where she was greeted by her robotic butler, Codsworth.
"Good morning, Mum! Your coffee, brewed to perfection!" He stated, placing a mug on the counter.
"Thanks, Codsworth", Nora said, taking a sip of the coffee. She smiled. It really was perfect.

From the hall, a cry was heard.
"Ah, looks like Shaun is awake! I shall attend to him!" Codsworth said, heading down the hall.
Sitting down on the couch, Nora turned on the TV. GNN blared to life.
Before she could watch the news, a knock was heard at the door.
"It's probably that salesman. He comes for you everyday", Nate said, walking into the living room.

Opening the door, Nora was greeted by a man wearing a yellow trench coat, and holding a clipboard.
"Good Morning! Vault-Tec calling!" The man greeted.
"Good morning", replied Nora.
"Isn't it? Just look at that sky..." The man said, before clearing his throat. "Anyway, I'm here to inform you that, due to your families contributions to our country, you have been pre-selected for entry into the local vault, Vault 111!"
"That's great. There is space for my family, right?"
The Vault-Tec rep nodded.
"Of course! There's room for everybody, minus your robot, of course. I just need some information. We wouldn't want any hold-ups in the event of total atomic annihilation!"

After filling out the survey, the Vault-Tec rep thanked Nora before heading off, presumably to the Vault.
"Well, that's good, if the war does happen", Nate said, who had been observing Nora's conversation.
"I'm not going to make a call on if it does. Hopefully, it doesn't..." Nora said, before Codsworth interrupted her.
"Miss Nora, Shaun has been changed but he absolutely refuses to calm down. Perhaps he could use some of that 'Maternal' affection you seem to be good at giving?"
Nora sighed. Who knew that being a parent was so hard?

In Shaun's room, Nora eventually calmed Shaun down.
"Good work. You are a great mother, you know that?" Nate said, hugging Nora.
"Yeah, I know", she replied.
"Now that that's over, how about we head to the park for the day?"
"Yes, the park. Because I want to get pregnant. Again!" Nora replied sarcastically, remembering their last visit to the park.
Before Nate could continue, they heard Codsworth from the other room.
"Sir? Mum? You may want to see this..."

Heading back into the living room, Nora stopped in front of the TV. Nate stopped beside her, a squirming Shaun in his arms.
"Reports are just in... Yes, we have confirmed detonations in New York and Pennsylvania. God, it's actually happ-"
The TV cut off. Alarms started blaring outside, causing Shaun to begin crying.
"We need to get to the Vault. Now!" Nate yelled.

Nate and Nora sprinted out of their house.
"Residents of Sanctuary Hills. If you are registered, proceed to Vault 111".
On the hill, Nora spotted a Verti-Bird landing.
"The Vault's up the hill! Hurry!" She shouted.
Sprinting up the hill, the trio stopped in front off a gate, flanked by two power armour units wielding miniguns.
"We need in! We're on the list!" Nora gasped. She wasn't in the best of shape, as shown by her belly, which formed a layer of flab.
"Adult male... Adult female... Infant. Alright, go ahead and God save you", the officer said, moving to the side.

Standing on the vault door, Nora bent over, gasping for breath. Beside her, Nate was barely out of breath, a testament to the time he spent in the Army.
"We'll be alright. I love you!" Nate said to Nora, smiling.
"Yeah... Love you... too..." Nora gasped, straightening up just in time to see a massive explosion to the south.
Everybody started yelling.
"Lower the elevator! Now!"
Right before the shock wave hit them, the elevator lowered and the door slid shut over their heads.

The next moments became a blur for Nora. She remembered stepping of an elevator, accepting a blue jumpsuit with 111 written on it...
"We need you to step in here. For... decontamination".
The scientists voice shocked Nora out of her daze. She looked at him with a blank look.
"Sorry?"
"Just step in here. And before I forget, you need this shot. It gets rid of any radiation you may have in your body", the scientist said, holding up a syringe full of a clear liquid.
"Yeah, sure..." Nora said absent-mindedly, still in shock.

Stepping into the decontamination chamber, Nora rubbed her arm where the syringe had pierced her skin. Whatever was in it had made her hungry... Hopefully, she'd get some food after this.
"The pod will decontaminate you before heading deeper in to the Vault. Just, relax!"
Breathing out, Nora's eyes began to shut. After a couple of seconds, she had fallen asleep.

What felt like a couple of seconds later, Nora awoke with a start. The door to the pod opened. She stepped forward, and immediately fell over. Alarms were sounding all around the Vault.
"What...?" Nora whispered. She had a really bad headache...
And then she remembered.

"Oh, God... Nate!"
She remembered two people, one in a hazmat suit of some kind, and the other wore a metal brace on his arm. They tried to take Shaun. Nate tried to stop them...
Looking into Nate's pod, a red stain confirmed her worst fear.
She fell to her knees, crying.

After a while, Nora stood up and wiped tears from her eyes. Looking around, she began aware of something...
15532222222221223111.title: War Never Changes

155322222222212231112.content:
Getting to her feet, Nora looked around the room. There were a number of other pods, and upon looking in them...
"Oh, God! Everybody's dead!"
This caused Nora to back into a corner, although she didn't know why. She had seen dead people before, at funerals, but seeing her neighbours, her husband dead in a Vault, supposedly one of the safest places on Earth, was overwhelming her.

"Why? What did Vault-Tec do?" She asked, taking a few cautious steps out of her corner. After a few seconds, she jumped back into it when she heard a loud rumble.
"What was that?!" Nora asked, fear in her voice. She wasn't designed for this kind of place. Nate had always been the rugged one in their relationship, hence why he joined the Army.
Another rumble.
Looking around the room, Nora eventually realized what the rumbling was.

It was her stomach, which made her feel silly, for being scared of it, and slightly embarrassed, as it was echoing around the room.
"Alright... Let's find some food, before I resort to cannibalism!"
Tiptoeing out the room as she was still uneasy about all the corpses, Nora tried to silence her stomach, which was almost roaring by this point.
As soon as Nora passed through the door, she heard it shut behind. She let out a breath of relief.
"Thank God..." She whispered. "Now, fo... Is that another room?!"
Peeking in the window, she saw another room full of cryo-pods.
She immediately ran through the door behind her.

Nora halted in front of a window. She was hunched over and breathing heavily. Sweat dotted her forehead.
"Oh... I'm so... unfit..." She gasped.
After regaining her breath, she straightened up and was met with the sight of a giant cockroach.
"Holy shit!" Nora yelled, causing the giant roach to jump off the window and scurry away.
Trying to push the giant cockroach from her mind, Nora focused on finding food. She was beginning to feel slightly faint.

Walking into an adjoining room, she found a security baton, which she stuck in one of her pockets, and a terminal. Sitting down in front of it, she powered it on.
"Let's see... For Security Only?"
Opening it, she found some disturbing things in it.
"Wait... Security revolted against the Overseer? That explains the lack of any living people. Although, it doesn't explain why everybody's dead. And the giant cockroach".
Turning the terminal off, she continued looking for food.

In the next room, Nora saw the giant cockroach. One of her first thoughts was "Run".
"No. It's only a cockroach, what can it do to hurt me?" Nora said, pulling out her baton.
Sneaking up behind it, she smashed the baton down on the roach. It died instantly.

1553222222222222222222222222222222221122.content:
It was done.

After all the struggle,

After all the hardships,

After all the..."changes",

And after all the sacrifices...

Their quest was complete.

Mila wished upon the orb and the enchanted coins, and changed the world. But...was it for the better? Sure, her intentions were for a more peaceful world, but at what cost?

Darious was dead, and so was Tam-Tam. And yet, she, Leeko, and Morgana were still here, living, changed, but living ssnd breathing nonetheless.

Mila stood up on the deck of her ship, The Pirate's Fate, looking out towards the moonlit horizon, her profound belly lightly pressing against the ship deck railings. Her mind contemplated what she and her friends had endured, whilst the moon made it's reflection upon the ocean surface.

But then, Mila was abruptly interrupted from behind, which came in the form of the chubby Princess Morgana, as the plump feline calmly wrapped her somewhat chubby arms around the slightly larger feline before her in a loving manner. "...Are you feeling alright, my dear Mila?" Morgana queried, "You seemed to be a tad...bothered by something."

In response to her newfound lover's concern, Mila gently placed her plump hands upon Morgana's own hands in a loving manner as well, where she then exhaled a deep sigh and replied, "...To be honest, Morgana. I...Morgana, did I do the right thing by allowing Queen Nakhta to become the ruler of the known world?"

"...With sincere honesty, my big fluffy feline: I believed what you wanted was a peaceful world. Sure, the Queen, my older sister, can be..."aggressive" at times, but..." Morgana retorted, where she then squeezed her puffy arms around Mila's round abdomen a bit in reassurance, as she then continued, "...You did what you believed was right, and I'll stick by your choice, WE'LL stick by your choice."

Eventually, Mila then turned herself around to face the chubby feline Morgana, where she soon proceeded to wrap her plump arms around the tubby princess with a hearty loving embrace and said, "...Thank you, Morgana." But suddenly, Mila's stomach then began to growl aloud, causing the fat tan feline to blush profusely in slight embarrassment.

Of course, Morgana giggled a little from such an embarrassing action of the body. "*giggle* Well, it sounds like a certain feline I know is starting to feel famished." Morgana chirped, lightly patting Mila's pronouned belly, which made Mila blush just a tad more.

Of course, after the blooming romance between her and the plump Princess Morgana, how could she say no to someone so loving and kind? In response, Mila displayed a loving smile upon her plump cherubic face and said, "On that, Morgana... I couldn't agree with you more."

From there, the two fat felines planted a brief but passionate kiss upon one another's lips, where they then proceeded toward the Captain's Quarters for some "personal" time with each other.

1553222222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
The sun was shining out over a beautiful day on the Wumpa Islands, with the perfect amount of puffy white clouds in the sky and all the lush wildlife in full, beautiful bloom. Of course, not that Coco'd know that at the moment, or care too much. She'd been cooped up inside for almost a week straight, lounging around the cozy little house near the beach which she, her brother, and their mystical mentor- Aku Aku- shared with one another. Why should she get out and enjoy the tropical paradise she was lucky enough to live in anyway?

She'd go outside when she felt like it, eventually, and she had all her stuff in here! Her laptop was always plugged in, so she didn't have to worry about it dying, and she had a TV with five different gaming consoles hooked up- It was a necessity, after all how else was she gonna play all the exclusive games? She also had a slightly larger, more powerful PC- which she would use for coding, running more intensive programs than her laptop could handle, or...playing other, different games. Also, a VR headset! She even had a small collection of drones, and little robots with extendo arms which she could- and often would- have bring her snacks and things when she didn't feel like getting up. Having picked up a lot of her technological equipment and skills on adventures thwarting mad scientists who could've taken over the world if it weren't for her and her brother, she'd accumulated some pretty advanced stuff after all.

and, well, there being no particularly powerful or threatening mad scientists popping up lately, Coco hadn't been getting much activity recently. Crash still loved to go out and run around the island, busting up boxes and jumping on natives and all this other stuff he liked to do, even when he didn't have an end goal in mind. But Coco was a bit more...practical. She was perfectly content with her sedentary lifestyle, laying there on her bed or on the couch or in her big cushiony computer chair, playing some videogame or fiddling around with new machines she was building or eating cheap snack foods. Staying up super late, taking frequent naps, forgetting to shower, graduating from three to six meals a day...it was inevitably starting to show on the spry young marsupial.

"bruUUurrrp- Crash? Hey, Crash!" Coco called out, alerting her brother- who happened to be inside, trying to master some kind of yo yo trick. Coco was on her bed, where she'd been since she moved there from her computer chair yesterday after dinner, stayed up playing games until 4 am, passed out, woke up, had breakfast, and was currently trying to program a functional physics engine to go with the modeling software she'd made a while ago. She was....portly. Her pink shoes were kicked off and laying near the door, where they'd been for weeks- She hadn't changed her outfit once, the slightly yellowish tint and visible dampness of her white T-shirt and tight, dirty socks (which had a few holes in them) showed that off. Her hair was in a ponytail, like usual, but it was messy- a few strands loose and some bedhead which she'd lazily mitigated by brushing through it with her greasy fingers. She had an inch thick layer of pudge around her body, more than an inch in places- With the bit of skin between her chin and neck filling out with fat, it was at the point where it bunched into an undeniable double chin when she looked down at her screen. The sleeves of her T-shirt dug into her upper arm fat, which folded around her elbow like pudgy fleshy water wings. the one strap of her overalls which was buttoned was being pushed into a bit, digging into her chest- which suddenly had gone up a few cup sizes.

Behind her you could see the crossed part of the straps pressing similarly into her back fat, with her butt protruding especially far. As she lay on her side, her hip rose a good foot or two into the air. The denim of her overalls' legs was tight around her own, which probably gave her squishy fatty thighs more definition than they would've had on their own. She also didn't smell particularly good, you could liken her body odor to a pile of extensively used gym socks, fresh ones. Also her breath had a sort of saccharine funk, the result of excessive consumption of sweets without the necessary...teeth brushing. Once Coco got her brother's attention, she held up an empty box of mini powdered donuts- As if it wasn't painfully obvious enough why it was empty, she still had the sugar around her lips and on her fingers. "I'm out of snacks- Do you think you could run down to the store and get me some more? Remember, you can use the warp pad to get to the place they sell this stuff." She said, remembering how the first time she asked this of him, Crash couldn't find a store on the island, so he collected her a bunch of berries and nuts. She still ate them of course- It was sweet- but he needed reminding of some things. "Just normal stuff- Chips, donuts, candy, soda, microwavable stuff...You know, whatever you can get your hands on." Coco said, idly adjusting her overalls over her utterly massive belly, sprawling out in front of her as she laid on her side, pulling her overalls as tight as they'd go, even oozing off the side of the bed a tiny bit. "Just don't keep me waiting too long, or I might get hungry enough to have to have dinner early!"


Crash was a simple bandicoot-He liked to run around in the jungle, pester some of the natives now and again (which was sometimes a little justified-They had tried to sacrifice him more than once) and, if all else fails, he'd simply take a nap. Maybe there was more to life than that, but if there was, Crash didn't care...or rather, he didn't know about it. Thinking wasn't always his strong suit, although he had Cortex to thank for messing up his brains into the state they were now-however, Cortex hadn't shown up for a long time now-last Crash or the others heard of him, he and Uka Uka had been sucked away into a portal or something. With all this free time on his hand, Crash had gotten....well, even more antsy than usual. He had grown so used to having to fight off mutant Tasmanian Tigers, Dingo Crocodile hybrids, and a plethora of other baddies spanning countless planes of realities and worlds that the stagnant lifestyle he had was starting to get to him. Sure, he didn't mind snoozing or relaxing now and again...but his impulsive nature had begun leaving him feeling bored.

So when Coco had called for him, he had to restrain himself from smashing through the wall of her room in excitement-he'd wave over to her with a smile, although he did wrinkle his nose a bit when he caught a whiff of her serious BO. When WAS the last time she bathed? Crash didn't pay it much mind, although he was already aching to get on the road. Coco had told him to run down to the store and buy some more snacks, Crash giving a nod of understanding before hurrying back out the door. Along the way, he ended up tripping over Polar and Pura who were cuddled up on the carpet in the living room. The loud din he created attracted his mentor's attention, Aku Aku floating down from his perch and raising an aged, wooden brow at finding Crash with his tongue being bitten by Pura as Polar had him pinned down, the bandicoot giving an embarrassed cackle.

As Pura and Polar untangled themselves and walked off to find a new place to sleep that would hopefully keep them out of range of Crash's destructive bumbling, Aku Aku would press Crash about what on earth he was in such a rush for. A bit of gibberish and babbling was Crash's reply, although the words 'Coco' were intermingled within his otherwise unintelligible explanation. "Already? Crash, didn't she send you out on a grocery run earlier today?" Crash rubbed his chin in thought, the Bandicoot trying to recall the events of his day-he had remembered getting some Wumpa Fruit, then after that he remembered running into some of the islanders who were still a bit sore from Crash accidentally knocking over their canoes. Then he saw a bird. Then he saw-

"Crash, I think it's about time you admit to yourself Coco's laziness is getting out of hand..." Aku Aku remarked, cutting Crash's train of thought short. When his brain had properly rebooted, Crash blew a raspberry and waved his mentor's fears away, before looking around for that little 'purse' thing Coco had always told him to take when she went shopping. "Crash, I know she's your sister and you care about her-But she's been sitting in her room for weeks now, and she hasn't come out except to grab something to eat. I think we really need to talk with her about this..." Aku Aku was met with silence, the mask turning about to find that Crash had already left-and didn't even notice the purse was on the counter either.

info.description:
An interactive weight gain story featuring a great number of ladies from the realm of video games. Along with standard characters who regularly get featured in stories like this, I also tried to include some more obscure and interesting choices. I encourage anyone to add and have fun.

Rule-wise, you can mostly go nuts, but I'd prefer it if you avoided farting and the like, and refrained from any vore. But aside from that, you've got my blessings.
